com.cs495.bucketbuddy

Class DatabaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.cs495.bucketbuddy.DatabaseHelper

  • public class DatabaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    Provides the interface into the database, translating back and forth between the Java objects representing Players and Teams and the data about them in the database.

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
             int oldVersion,
             int newVersion)
        Description copied from class: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Called when the database needs to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to drop tables, add tables, or do anything else it needs to upgrade to the new schema version.

        The SQLite ALTER TABLE documentation can be found here. If you add new columns you can use ALTER TABLE to insert them into a live table. If you rename or remove columns you can use ALTER TABLE to rename the old table, then create the new table and then populate the new table with the contents of the old table.

        This method executes within a transaction. If an exception is thrown, all changes will automatically be rolled back.

        Specified by:
        onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - The database.
        oldVersion - The old database version.
        newVersion - The new database version.

      • addStatEntity

        public StatEntity addStatEntity(StatEntity entity)
        Adds a new StatEntity (player or team) to the database). Creates the StatEntity in the database and assigns its id to the java object.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to be added
        Returns:
        the given entity with its id set to the value given to it in the database

      • updateStatEntity

        public void updateStatEntity(StatEntity entity)
        Updates the given StatEntity's information in the database. All Attrs, Seasons, Games, and GameStats will be "INSERT OR UPDATE"ed, meaning they will be added if not present, and their values will be overwritten if they are already there. This method assumes the StatEntity has already been added to the db via the addStatEntity method.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to be updated

      • deleteStatEntity

        public void deleteStatEntity(long id)
        Deletes the StatEntity with the given id from the database. All related Attrs, Seasons, Games, and GameStats will be deleted as well.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the StatEntity to delete

      • getStatEntity

        public StatEntity getStatEntity(long entityId)
        Pulls the StatEntity with the given id from the database.
        Parameters:
        entityId - the id of the StatEntity to retrieve
        Returns:
        the StatEntity with all attrs, seasons, games, and stats from the database

      • getAllTeams

        public java.util.ArrayList<Team> getAllTeams()
        Returns all teams currently present in the database.
        Returns:
        an arraylist of all teams in the database

      • loadAttrs

        private StatEntity loadAttrs(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                   StatEntity entity)
        Loads all attributes describing the given entity into that entity. This includes the entity's teamId if the entity is a player or the entity's playerIds if the entity is a team.
        Parameters:
        db - the pointer to the database
        entity - the entity into which to load attributes
        Returns:
        the entity with all attributes filled out

      • loadSeasons

        private StatEntity loadSeasons(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                     StatEntity entity)
        Loads all Seasons into the given entity. This entails loading all Games into each Season and all GameStats into each Game.
        Parameters:
        db - the pointer to the database
        entity - the entity into which to load seasons
        Returns:
        the entity with all seasons, games, and gamestats filled out

      • loadGames

        private Season loadGames(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
               Season season,
               int seasonNumber,
               long entityId)
        Loads all games into the given season. This entails loading all GameStats into each Game.
        Parameters:
        db - the pointer to the database
        season - the season into which to load games
        seasonNumber - the number of the season -- part of the games' primary key
        entityId - the id of the entity to which the season belongs -- part of the games' primary key
        Returns:
        the season with all games and gamestats filled out

      • loadStats

        private Game loadStats(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
             Game game,
             int gameNumber,
             int seasonNumber,
             long entityId)
        Loads all gamestats into the given game.
        Parameters:
        db - the pointer to the database
        game - the game into which to load gamestats
        gameNumber - the number of the game -- part of the gamestats' primary key
        seasonNumber - the number of the season -- part of the gamestats' primary key
        entityId - the id of the entity to which the season/game belong -- part of the gamestats' primary key
        Returns:
        the game with all gamestats filled out

        Returns:
